page.title: 15Mrs. Howard of Golden Hayes
page.content:
Mrs Howard has lived at Golden Hayes since 1939. The family nanny stayed on to help after the children had grown up.
She remembers how everybody used to wear a hat. When her mother met the family cook in the village one day, without a hat on, she told her she must never go out again without a hat.
The grocer called on Mondays for orders, and delivered on Fridays. The baker, butcher, milkman, fishmonger and greengrocer called each week.
Mrs Howard recalls Sundays with special clothes, going to church, no playing of games, only reading,a special Sunday lunch and singing hymns around the piano after tea. .
